name: causatively
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that relates to the causes of something: These are serious issues, but they were not causatively relevant to the tragic outcome of her illness. Clients may potentially suffer damage that might be causatively linked to this process.
More examplesFewer examplesHis directing style was one of jumps, cuts, and sudden breaks, where nothing exactly follows anything else causatively.It is not possible to conclude that his mental illness was causatively relevant to his later death.In these errors, intransitive verbs are used causatively in transitive frames.
